page.title: 07DACCOMBE VILLAGE.
page.content: We realised that Daccombe is a very rural area,with only few houses.It is mostly fields,so the land cover survey is:Primary-Enclosed Rough Grazing. Secondary-Intensively Managed Grassland.Tertiary-Farmland-Crops other than grass.Most of the cottages are around the lower part of Daccombe called the Hamlet.The cottages are probably homes of wealthy people since they are well maintained and some have swimming pools.There is only one amenity, a caravan site for holiday makers.There is nothing else.The main traffic is tractors travelling to near by farms ,local cars and a bus service which travels via Daccombe once a week on Wednesday which takes people to Newton Abbot where a market is held every week. Most of the area is taken up with fields with only a few cottages and little amenities.
